Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the amount of money invested in military equipment, stating it as $2.5 trillion when the actual cost of purchasing new military equipment was 20% of that.
Understate: The claim understates the total defense budgets from 2017 to 2020, which were approximately $2.9 trillion in inflation-adjusted dollars.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that all of the budget money was spent on equipment.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that investing in military equipment equates to "rebuilding" the military.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the claim, which is that the amount mentioned by Trump is not unusual in the context of defense budgets.
